ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned about various topics such as gossiping, network control, rigidity, etc. and reviewed important linear algebra concepts.
Linear Algebra mainly, and some control theory
Linear algebra and some theoretical understanding of distributed systems
Overview about recent topics in electrical engineering research, particularly in systems and controls

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was pretty disorganized. There were only a couple assignments thats err mainly meant to practice linear algebra. Professor Morse was very kind and contributed a lot of interesting perspectives which made the class more interesting.
The topic is a bit too hard for undergrads, so he taught it in a pretty superficial level.
He is a very nice professor and clearly knows a lot, but the class was not very structured, and I'm not sure how the topics taught in class really applied to whatever field.

Strength: not a lot of work load
Weakness: not a lot of people understood what's going on in the class

Strengths: Good overview about recent topics in electrical engineering research that could be helpful for those who are interested in conducting independent research. Very low workload and chill professor. Weaknesses: What one learns from the class entirely depends on what one puts in. There are only five homework assignments and one oral exam, so those who lack motivation to actually learn something from the class will probably end up learning very little. This may be a plus or minus depending on what one expects to get out of the class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Its basically a lecture series. If you go to class and listen its interesting. If not you dont really have to do anything. Dont expect an amazing class but its also an ok fifth credit.
If you want an easy course in CS/EE and wants practice in linear algebra.
If you need a elective credit, it is quite easy, but I'm not sure I learned much.
If you're looking for a free A, this course isn't bad. But it is very dry. No one really understands anything.

I would only recommend this course to another student if they have substantial background in electrical engineering (or related areas) and are looking for potential research topics in systems and controls. The course has almost no work, so the reservation is not about the difficulty of the coursework. Rather, I believe one would get very little out of the course without appropriate background and real motivation.
